title: FTX Estate Stakes $122 Million Solana (SOL), Quells Fear Of Token Sell-Off - NewsBTC
content:
The FTX estate has reportedly staked 5.5 million Solana (SOL), worth $122 million. This development comes amidst fears of the defunct crypto exchange liquidating a substantial portion of its SOL holdings and inducing a bearish trend.

FTX Renews Bullish Interest In Solana With Latest Move

On October 14, blockchain tracking platform Whale Alert reported that 5.5 million SOL had been transferred between two unknown wallets. Thereafter, a crypto analyst with the X username ashpool soon identified the FTX exchange to be behind this whale transaction.

Using data from gelato.sh, ashpool revealed that the FTX exchange had delegated the said 5.5 million SOL to the Figment staking service, an active validator on the Solana network.

In September, the management of the bankrupt crypto exchange obtained court approval to liquidate its crypto holdings, valued at $3.4 billion, as they look to pay off their creditors.

Solana accounts for the largest part of FTX’s crypto assets, with the exchange reportedly owning 55.8 million SOL, worth $1.16 billion.

However, the majority of this SOL are currently staked, with FTX reportedly having access to 7 million SOL as of September, most of which had been sold off.

Related Reading

SOL Price Prediction: Will Correction Trend Push Solana Under $20? 7 months ago

On October 6, 9.1 million SOL, worth about $212 million, owned by Alameda Research – FTX’s defunct trading wing – were reportedly unstaked, prompting new fears of market sell-off by the FTX estate.

However, FTX’s latest move to stake 5.5 million SOL shows the exchange is holding on to its SOL investments for now, which could be interpreted as a reassuring move for traders with fears of liquidation.

Despite its bankrupt status, FTX is still considered a major player in the Solana ecosystem, owning 10% of SOL’s total supply. In addition to its SOL holdings, FTX also owns 20,500 BTC worth $560 million and 112,600 ETH, worth $192 million, among other crypto assets.

Related Reading

SOL Up By 16% In One Month

In other news, SOL is up by 16.06% in the last months despite fears of liquidation and worrying factors linked to the FTX exchange.

Most recently, there were circulating rumors that the defunct exchange could “switch off” the Solana blockchain if it found the need to liquidate the long position of traders.

However, these rumors were soon debunked by multiple accounts as fake. In fact, Jacob Creech, Head of Developers at Solana, drew the community’s attention to the fact there is a $400,000 SOL bounty for anyone who can find a “switch off” for the network.

At the time of writing, SOL is trading at $21.98, with a 2.34% gain in the last day. Meanwhile, the token’s daily trading volume is up by 10.18% and is valued at $267.07 million.

SOL trading at $21.93 on the hourly chart | Source: SOLUSDT chart on Tradingview.com

Featured image from Cryptodose, chart from Tradingview

title: Solana (SOL) Faces Challenges Amidst Ex-CEO’s Trial - The Currency Analytics
content:
In the ever-evolving world of cryptocurrency, Solana (SOL), once a favored digital asset on FTX, finds itself in a challenging spot as it dips in value. The recent downturn in SOL’s fortunes can be partly attributed to the ongoing trial of Sam Bankman-Fried, the former CEO of the crypto brand.

Solana, currently the eighth largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, has witnessed a decline in its value. As of this writing, SOL is priced at $21.19, reflecting a 3% drop in the past 24 hours and a more substantial 7% decline over the past week, according to data from CoinGecko.

The connection between SOL’s performance and Bankman-Fried’s trial may not be coincidental. The cryptocurrency has been frequently mentioned during the legal proceedings. In a recent development, Mark S. Cohen, the lawyer representing Bankman-Fried, discussed his client’s interest in SOL.

SOL is the native digital asset used for transactions on the Solana blockchain, a platform that empowers developers to create decentralized applications (dApps) with a particular focus on decentralized finance lending protocols.

Solana’s Recent Struggles

Solana, often referred to as SOL, has encountered a series of challenges that have impacted its market performance. Its current position as the eighth largest cryptocurrency underscores its importance in the digital asset landscape. However, recent events, particularly the legal proceedings involving Sam Bankman-Fried, have cast a shadow on SOL’s performance.

The price of SOL has taken a hit, with a 3% drop in the last 24 hours and a more substantial 7% decline over the past week. This dip has raised concerns among investors and enthusiasts of the cryptocurrency market. The relationship between SOL’s decline and the ongoing trial is a subject of interest.

The Role of Sam Bankman-Fried

Sam Bankman-Fried, the former CEO of the crypto exchange FTX, has been at the center of attention due to his involvement in the crypto world. His trial, which is currently underway, has brought several aspects of his career and interests to light.

Bankman-Fried’s lawyer, Mark S. Cohen, recently mentioned his client’s enthusiasm for SOL, adding a layer of intrigue to the ongoing trial. The connection between the trial and SOL’s performance is an aspect that continues to captivate the crypto community.

Solana and Its Utility

Solana is a blockchain platform that provides a fertile ground for developers to create decentralized applications, commonly known as dApps. Among these applications, decentralized finance (DeFi) lending protocols have taken center stage, demonstrating the versatility and potential of the Solana blockchain.

The native digital asset of Solana, SOL, plays a pivotal role in facilitating transactions and activities on the network. Its importance in the Solana ecosystem cannot be overstated, making it a subject of interest not only for developers but also for investors and traders in the cryptocurrency space.

The Impact on SOL’s Value

The recent downturn in SOL’s value raises questions about the cryptocurrency’s future. The connection to the trial of Sam Bankman-Fried has certainly affected market sentiment. Investors and traders are closely monitoring the situation, looking for clues that could help them navigate this challenging period.

The decline in SOL’s value may also be linked to the increased scrutiny and uncertainty surrounding the broader cryptocurrency market. As regulators and authorities across the globe seek to establish a regulatory framework for digital assets, cryptocurrencies are experiencing increased volatility.

The Broader Cryptocurrency Landscape

The world of cryptocurrencies is a dynamic and ever-changing one. While some digital assets have reached remarkable heights, they are not immune to market forces and external factors. The trial of prominent figures in the crypto space can have far-reaching effects on the assets they are associated with, as we are seeing in the case of Solana.

SOL’s performance in recent days mirrors the broader cryptocurrency landscape, where the values of many digital assets are subject to fluctuations driven by market sentiment, news events, and regulatory developments.

Looking Ahead

As Solana navigates through these challenging times, the cryptocurrency community and investors are eager to see how its value will evolve. The outcome of Sam Bankman-Fried’s trial, coupled with the regulatory landscape, will likely play a significant role in shaping SOL’s future.

The broader lesson from SOL’s recent dip is a reminder that the cryptocurrency market is still maturing, and its participants must be prepared for a degree of uncertainty. While this volatility presents opportunities, it also underscores the importance of staying informed and cautious when engaging in the crypto space.

In conclusion, the challenges faced by Solana (SOL) in recent days have brought the spotlight onto the cryptocurrency market’s complexities. As the trial of Sam Bankman-Fried unfolds, the world will be watching to see how it impacts the fate of SOL and the wider cryptocurrency landscape.
